Description: Rim and wall sherd of North Ionian pottery plate; cream slip; stopt maeander between lines on top of rim; band with added red band lined in white at edge of floor; to the inside, metopal frieze of tongues and eight-petal star rosette, part in red; band to the centre with added white; frieze of rectangles between lines on outside of rim, underside glazed; four bands and two lines preserved on exterior wall. Micaceous clay with numerous small to medium-sized white lime inclusions (Munsell 5YR 7/6). Hole drill for analysis.
Curator's comments: Analysed with NAA by H. Mommsen (in Villing & Schlotzhauer 2006, pp. 69-76): sample Nauk 54, Group B
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (pp. 56-57 fig. 3, Table 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.741)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 86, Nau 26, pl. 6g-h)
